Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.dns

Class DNSResourceRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.dns.DNSResourceRecord
  • public final class DNSResourceRecord
extends java.lang.Object
    A DNS resource record.

    Resource records appear in the answer, authority, and additional sections of DNS responses.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DNSResourceRecord​(java.lang.String name, DNSType type, DNSClass dnsClass, int ttl, byte[] rdata)
      Creates a new DNS resource record.

        Creates a new DNS resource record.
        Parameters:
        name - the domain name
        type - the record type
        dnsClass - the record class
        ttl - time to live in seconds
        rdata - the record data

      • mx

        public static DNSResourceRecord mx​(java.lang.String name,
                                   int ttl,
                                   int preference,
                                   java.lang.String exchange)
        Creates an MX record.
        Parameters:
        name - the domain name
        ttl - time to live in seconds
        preference - the preference value (lower = higher priority)
        exchange - the mail server hostname
        Returns:
        the resource record

      • txt

        public static DNSResourceRecord txt​(java.lang.String name,
                                    int ttl,
                                    java.lang.String text)
        Creates a TXT record.
        Parameters:
        name - the domain name
        ttl - time to live in seconds
        text - the text content
        Returns:
        the resource record

      • soa

        public static DNSResourceRecord soa​(java.lang.String name,
                                    int ttl,
                                    java.lang.String mname,
                                    java.lang.String rname,
                                    int serial,
                                    int refresh,
                                    int retry,
                                    int expire,
                                    int minimum)
        Creates an SOA record.
        Parameters:
        name - the domain name
        ttl - time to live in seconds
        mname - the primary name server
        rname - the responsible person email (@ replaced with .)
        serial - the serial number
        refresh - the refresh interval
        retry - the retry interval
        expire - the expire time
        minimum - the minimum TTL
        Returns:
        the resource record

      • getAddress

        public java.net.InetAddress getAddress()
        Interprets the RDATA as an IP address (for A or AAAA records).
        Returns:
        the IP address
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this is not an A or AAAA record

      • getTargetName

        public java.lang.String getTargetName()
        Interprets the RDATA as a domain name (for CNAME, PTR, NS records).
        Returns:
        the domain name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this is not a name-type record

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Interprets the RDATA as TXT record content.
        Returns:
        the text content
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this is not a TXT record

      • getMXPreference

        public int getMXPreference()
        Returns the MX preference (for MX records).
        Returns:
        the preference value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this is not an MX record

        public java.lang.String getMXExchange()
        Returns the MX exchange hostname (for MX records).
        Returns:
        the mail server hostname
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this is not an MX record
